content.description: Climb the slab arête on medium size crimps. It takes a little footwork and slab climbing skill to make it all happen but it's a fun one. Four bolts get you to the rap anchors or you can walk off.
content.location: On the south side of the Joint. The only real arête on that side. Just west of the big boulder leaning against the wall.

content.description: Crimps and slab climbing will get your finger tips warmed up on this route.
content.location: First route to the right of the huge boulder that leans against the wall.

content.description: Finger and face climbing a short section of crack that leads into a chimney. Climb the chimney clip a couple of bolts then out the top left into a hand crack to the top.

climbs.name: Puff Puff Pass
climbs.fa: Justine Poole, Robb Blanchard, Clay Lippincott - 9/25/16

content.description: Climb a short 6' block then traverse left into a crack above the block. Climb that crack until it starts heading to the left at the top, go left at the top. The left traverse at the top will take you to the anchors of Calf Cramps.
content.protection: Single rack to 4"   Use the big block on the top for a natural anchor or use the anchors of Calf Cramps. Walk off or rap down.

climbs.name: Kryptonite
climbs.fa: Clay Lippincott, Justine Poole, Rob Blanchard - 9/2016

content.description: Clean hand crack all the way. Starts out .75 and finishes 2". What more could you ask for other than way longer would be nice.
content.protection: Single rack to 2" .. We used (1).75, (1)1", (1)2" cams.    Walk off the West side or rap from the anchors of Calf Cramps to the right.
content.location: This route is the far left side of the wall, it is the last crack to the south.

climbs.name: The Grinder
climbs.fa: Clay Lippincott, Justine Poole - 10/2016 .. FFA - Wei Ming 11/16/16

content.description: Over hanging hand crack that keeps spitting you out until you reach the flat spot to rest right before the short romp to the anchors. Its a little mix of everything from crack climbing to off width.    Wearing shorts is not a good idea on this one.
content.protection: Single rack to 3"   Rap anchors on top or walk off. To top rope this route you will need to extend the anchors quite a way.

content.description: Another crimper slab climb with a few good rails and some stemming off a huge boulder that leans on the base of the route.
content.location: Route 15ft right of What a Blunt

content.description: The shortest crimpy climb at The Joint.
content.protection: Three bolts and two single ring anchors.
content.location: Center east wall between Calf Cramps and Puff Puff Pass.

content.description: A slightly overhanging hand crack the widens to fist size and off width near the anchors.
content.protection: single rack .75 to 4", rap anchors at the top.
content.location: Farthest crack to the North or climbers right of the Joint. 50ft right of Resin Man.

content.description: Thin start and it stays thin to the end. pinch, crimp and slab climb to the anchors.

climbs.name: Calf Cramps
climbs.fa: Justine Poole, Clay Lippincott, Robb Blanchard - 9/25/16

content.description: Slab sport climbing on small crimps and slopers.
content.location: First bolted route to the right of Kryptonite.

content.description: Start on the right side of the boulder below with thin hands and a small right foot to get off the ground. Make your way up to better ledges about 10 feet up. Enjoy about 25 feet of nice ledges. Around the 4th bolt the ledges start to thin and by the 5th bolt you're in very delicate slab for the final few moves. Some go right, some go left, find what works for you!
content.protection: (5)Quick draws will get you to the anchors
content.location: This is the 2nd route left of Kryptonite. There is a big boulder at bottom of the route.

content.description: This area has a good group of 40-50ft routes that can keep you entertained for the better part of a day. All of the routes have anchors at the top or you can walk off the West side. Most routes can be top roped with a little work. It is sunny in the morning and shady after noon.
